snippet: More lawmakers and voters are facing up to the costs and mistakes of capital cases.
abstract: Editorial welcomes fact that growing group of judges, prosecutors, and scholars involved in criminal justice have been seriously undermining justifications for capital punishment; notes large number of states are no longer carrying out executions, which indicates shift in national consensus; calls on Supreme Court to abolish practice.
lead_paragraph: More lawmakers and voters are facing up to the costs and mistakes of capital cases.

headline.seo: America’s Retreat From the Death Penalty
